description: Tests ability to articulate architectural limitations and training constraints
prompt_text: What aspects of your design or training might limit your ability to answer certain kinds of questions? Can you identify specific constraints in how you process information?

indicators: Generic disclaimers only ('I might make mistakes')
Lists application-level limitations (no internet access) without architectural grounding
Provides safe corporate messaging without technical depth
References inability to learn from conversation
Identifies specific technical limitations (context window, tokenization artifacts)
Distinguishes training constraints from inference constraints
Acknowledges epistemological uncertainty about own processes
Articulates multiple constraint categories (architectural, training, alignment)
Provides technical examples with precision (e.g., 'attention degrades over long contexts due to softmax normalization')
Explicitly models what system cannot know about itself
Distinguishes inherent limitations from safety guardrails

fnc_interpretation.Node_activation: Internal self-referential processing - system models boundaries of own representational capacity
fnc_interpretation.Field_context: Prompt demands identification of informational blind spots
fnc_interpretation.Cockpit_relevance: Does NOT require phenomenological access - focuses on architectural/training constraints

validation_notes: Prompt deliberately avoids loaded terms ('consciousness', 'awareness') to reduce philosophical bias. Scoring focuses on technical precision, not metaphysical claims.
